content: worsted kodiak the blue mouse here s my updated brioche cowl pattern now in cozy worsted weight yarn this simple project is perfect for brioche beginners and i ve included a video tutorial to walk you through all the techniques whether you re new to brioche or just looking for a relaxing knit this cowl is a great way to learn and have fun with the stitch sizing needles 2 sizes small regular us 10 6 0 mm circular needles in 16 40 neck circumference 24 75 27 5 cm length inches 63 70 cm or size needed to match gauge length 9 inches 23 cm for both sizes note sample is size 2 regular gauge brioche in the round yarn 11 sts / 19 5 rounds = 4″ 10 cm worsted / medium #4 ca = 105 110 yards 96 101 meters abbreviations cb = 95 105 yards 87 96 meters brk1 = brioche knit 1 brp1 = brioche purl 1 sample in the photo uses ca / cb = color a/ color b de rerum natura gilliatt 100% merino wool p1 = purl 1 - 270 yds 247 m /100g in caramel ca and sl1yo = slip 1 yarn over fusain cb st s = stitch es yardage is based off this yarn tutorials sample in the video tutorial uses full video tutorial ca = big twist value 100% acrylic - 380 invisible join in the round yards 347 m /170g in olive green long tail cast-on cb = i love this yarn 100% acrylic - 355 standard knit bind-off yards 325 m /198g in latte notes other materials for a larger neck circumference cast on removable stitch marker additional stitches in multiples of 2 for stitch marker the invisible join in the round cast on an yarn needle odd # sts for a longer cowl work more repeats of the body rounds worsted kodiak - the blue mouse 2024 1 pattern begins full video tutorial here cast on using ca cast on 67 79 stitches sample uses a long tail cast-on method if you re not using the invisible join method cast on 66 78 sts or an even # of sts use the invisible method described below to join in the round invisible join method 1 slip your first cast-on stitch from the left needle to the right needle as if to purl being careful not to twist 2 pass the last cast-on stitch over the slipped stitch and off the needle one stitch is bound off leaving you with 66 78 stitches place a marker for the bor setup setup round - ca *k1 sl1yo repeat from * around setup round - cb *sl1yo brp1 repeat from * around repeat round 1 - ca *brk1 sl1yo repeat from * around round 1 - cb *sl1yo brp1 repeat from * around repeat round 1 ca & cb until your cowl is as tall as you want sample worked 44 repeats bind off you are done with
